destroy - destroy anonymous object

CONTENTS

  • SYNOPSIS
  • DESCRIPTION
  • VERSION
  • SPONSORSHIP
  • COPYRIGHT
  • SEE ALSO

SYNOPSIS

#include <ShoreApp.h>
shrc Ref<T>::destroy() const;

DESCRIPTION

Destroy destroys the referenced anonymous object. To destroy a registered object, use Shore::unlink. If the object is currently resident in the object cache, then it is removed from the cache, releasing the memory held by the object. Destroy obtains an EX (exclusive) mode lock on the destroyed object.

VERSION

This manual page applies to Version 1.1.1 of the Shore software.

SPONSORSHIP

The Shore project is sponsored by the Advanced Research Project Agency, ARPA order number 018 (formerly 8230), monitored by the U.S. Army Research Laboratory under contract DAAB07-91-C-Q518.
